block.p: COMING this Wednesday to Film Forum is ''Dark Days,'' which explores the homeless community that lives in the train tunnels beneath Manhattan. Dee, a tunnel dweller for a year now, is shown here shaving the head of Ralph, who has lived in the tunnel for three years.
Marc Singer, the director, made the tunnel his home for the two years that he was working on ''Dark Days.'' His entire production crew consisted of people from the tunnel.

COMING this Wednesday to Film Forum is ''Dark Days,'' which explores the homeless community that lives in the train tunnels beneath Manhattan. Dee, a tunnel dweller for a year now, is shown here shaving the head of Ralph, who has lived in the tunnel for three years.
Marc Singer, the director, made the tunnel his home for the two years that he was working on ''Dark Days.'' His entire production crew consisted of people from the tunnel.
During the filming, Amtrak officials ordered the residents evicted; the community sought help from the Coalition for the Homeless, and the struggle is depicted in the film.

''Dark Days''; Wednesday through Sept. 12, screenings daily at 1, 2:45, 4:30, 6:15, 8, and 10 p.m.; Film Forum, 209 West Houston Street, west of Avenue of the Americas; $9; weekday shows beginning before 5 p.m., for Forum members and people over 65, $5; (212) 727-8110.
